short_summary: Two (2) watercrafts and one (1) double trailer required for the RCMP
description: The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) requires... the purchase of two (2) fiberglass (FRP), jet powered personal watercraft (PWC) with one (1) trailer to carry both safely. Each will be supporting Policing operations including Patrol and Search and Rescue (SAR) covering extensive areas on the St. Lawrence River from the Ontario border, Quebec side to Gaspe. All the deliverables must be received on or before March 31st, 2023.
full_summary:
## Government Tender Announcement
### Project Description
The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) is seeking to acquire two (2) jet-powered personal watercraft (PWC) and one (1) double trailer for the purpose of supporting Policing operations, including Patrol and Search and Rescue (SAR) missions, in extensive areas of the St. Lawrence River.

### Key Requirements
* Two (2) fiberglass (FRP), jet-powered PWC with one (1) double trailer to carry both safely
* Delivers must be received on or before March 31st, 2023
* Bidder must comply with all requirements of the bid solicitation to be declared responsive
* Responsive bid with the lowest evaluated price will be recommended for contract award

### Submission Guidelines
* Tenders must be submitted to the RCMP Bid Receiving Unit at 4225 Dorchester West, Westmount, QC, H3Z 1V5
* Refer to the attached tender documents for further information
* Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada
* The Crown retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement

### Contact Information
* Marie-Eve Brunet, Procurement & Contracting
* Phone: 514-939-8488 x3355
* Email: mary.eve.brunet@rcmp-grc.gc.ca

### Reference Information
* Tender Reference Number: PW-22-01006830
* Solicitation Number: 202300123/A
* Tender Closing Date: October 24, 2022, at 14:00:00

### Notice Details
* The RCMP has adopted the Integrity Regime administered by Public Services and Procurement Canada
* Bidders are required to adhere to the Integrity Regime provisions
* Canada will make available Notices of Proposed Procurement (NPP), bid solicitations, and related documents for download through the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) at http://www.buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders
* It is the sole responsibility of the Bidder to regularly consult GETS for the most up-to-date information.

---

Note: I preserved most of the original info but removed less relevant details and adapted them to make them easier to read. Let me know if you have further requests. 

 As English is not the primary language of the contractor, I tried to stay true to the original (rephrased some parts to make them clear, maintained specific terminology used) so when possible. I will adapt this output
